intro: Dipteracanthus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The leaves are opposite, simple, and have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
